en_first_half: In the population of Transylvania there are four distinct nationalities: Saxons in the South, and mixed with them the Wallachs, who are the descendants of the Dacians; Magyars in the West, and Szekelys in the East and North. I am going among the latter, who claim to be descended from Attila and the Huns. This may be so, for when the
en_second_half: Magyars conquered the country in the eleventh century they found the Huns settled in it. I read that every known superstition in the world is gathered into the horseshoe of the Carpathians, as if it were the centre of some sort of imaginative whirlpool; if so my stay may be very interesting. (Mem., I must ask the Count all about them.)
en_results_raw: The Huns swept through Europe in the 5th century, leaving behind a legacy of conquest and cultural exchange. The Szekelys, with their rich history and proud heritage, have managed to preserve many of the traditions and customs of their ancestors. As I journey deeper into the heart of Transylvania, I am struck by the stark contrast between the lush, rolling hills and the rugged, mountainous terrain. The Szekelys are a hardy people, adapted to the harsh conditions of the Carpathian Mountains, where they have lived for centuries. Their language, a unique blend of Hungarian and Romanian, is a testament to their complex history and cultural identity. As I interact with the locals, I begin to notice a deep sense of pride and loyalty to their heritage, a sense of being part of a long line of warriors and hunters who have roamed these lands for generations. The Szekelys are a people who value their independence and self-reliance, and they take great pride in their ability to survive and thrive in one of the most inhospitable regions of Europe. Despite the challenges they face, they remain a vibrant and resilient community, with a strong sense of identity and a deep connection to their land and their ancestors. As I continue my journey, I am struck by the beauty and complexity of this fascinating culture, and I am grateful for the opportunity to learn from and learn about the Szekely people.
vi_first_half: Có bốn chủng tộc sống ở Transylvame: ở phía nam là những người Saxon sống lẫn với người Wallach vốn có xuất xứ từ sắc tộc Dacian; ở phía tây là người Magyard; còn ở phía đông và phía bắc là người Szekely. Tôi sẽ nghỉ lại cùng những người Szekely. Nghe nói họ xuất thân từ Attila và là hậu duệ của người Hung nô. Có lẽ điều này là có thật bởi vì vào thế kỷ thứ mười hai, khi người Magyard đi chinh phục xứ
vi_second_half: sở mà hiện nay họ đang sống, thì người Hung đã sinh cơ lập nghiệp ở đó rồi. Dường như mọi mê tín dị đoan trên thế giới đều có ở vùng Carpates, và tất cả luôn làm khuấy động trí tưởng tượng của dân gian. Nếu thực tế đúng là như vậy, thì những ngày nghỉ lại xứ này của tôi chắc sẽ rất thú vị. (Chắc chắn tôi sẽ luôn quấy rầy ngài bá tước với những câu hỏi về cái tín ngưỡng dị đoan này).

es_first_half: En la población de Transilvania hay cuatro nacionalidades distintas: sajones en el sur, y mezclados con ellos los valacos, que son descendientes de los dacios; magiares en el oeste, y escequelios en el este y el norte. Voy entre estos últimos, que aseguran ser descendientes de Atila y los hunos. Esto puede ser cierto, puesto que cuando los magiares conquistaron el país,
es_second_half: en el siglo XI, encontraron a los hunos, que ya se habían establecido en él. Leo que todas las supersticiones conocidas en el mundo están reunidas en la herradura de los Cárpatos, como si fuese el centro de alguna especie de remolino imaginativo; si es así, mi estancia puede ser muy interesante. (Recordar que debo preguntarle al conde acerca de esas supersticiones).
es_results_raw: que se refugiaron en estas montañas, y allí se mezclaron con los escequelios. Los escequelios, que habían sido anteriormente una tribu nómada, se asentaron en estas tierras y desarrollaron una cultura única, influenciada por sus antiguos orígenes y su contacto con los valacos y los sajones. A pesar de su origen huno, los escequelios no se consideran a sí mismos como una rama de los hunos, sino más bien como una nación independiente con una identidad propia. Su lengua, que es una mezcla de dialectos escequelios y valacos, es una de las lenguas más ricas y complejas de la región, con una rica tradición oral y una gran variedad de canciones y leyendas. La religión de los escequelios es una fusión de creencias paganas y cristianas, reflejando su historia compleja y su contacto con diferentes culturas. A pesar de su pequeña población, los escequelios han jugado un papel importante en la historia de Transilvania, y su legado cultural y lingüístico sigue siendo una parte importante de la identidad de la región. En la actualidad, los escequelios siguen viviendo en las montañas, donde han desarrollado una sociedad tradicional y una economía basada en la agricultura y la ganadería. Aunque enfrentan desafíos para preservar su identidad y su cultura en un mundo cada vez más globalizado, los escequelios siguen siendo una nación orgullosa y respetada en Transilvania.

en_first_half: 4 May.—I found that my landlord had got a letter from the Count, directing him to secure the best place on the coach for me; but on making inquiries as to details he seemed somewhat reticent, and pretended that he could not understand my German. This could not be true, because up to then he had understood it perfectly; at least, he answered my questions exactly as if he did. He and his wife, the old lady who had received me, looked at each other in a frightened
en_second_half: sort of way. He mumbled out that the money had been sent in a letter, and that was all he knew. When I asked him if he knew Count Dracula, and could tell me anything of his castle, both he and his wife crossed themselves, and, saying that they knew nothing at all, simply refused to speak further. It was so near the time of starting that I had no time to ask any one else, for it was all very mysterious and not by any means comforting.

es_first_half: 4 de mayo. Averigüé que mi posadero había recibido una carta del conde, ordenándole que asegurara el mejor lugar del coche para mí; pero al inquirir acerca de los detalles, se mostró un tanto reticente y pretendió no poder entender mi alemán. Esto no podía ser cierto, porque hasta esos momentos lo había entendido perfectamente; por lo menos respondía a mis preguntas exactamente como si las entendiera. Él y su mujer, la anciana que me había recibido, se miraron con temor. Él murmuró que
es_second_half: el dinero le había sido enviado en una carta, y que era todo lo que sabía. Cuando le pregunté si conocía al Conde Drácula y si podía decirme algo de su castillo, tanto él como su mujer se persignaron, y diciendo que no sabían nada de nada, se negaron simplemente a decir nada más. Era ya tan cerca a la hora de la partida que no tuve tiempo de preguntarle a nadie más, pero todo me parecía muy misterioso y de ninguna manera tranquilizante.
es_results_raw: había estado trabajando en la casa durante muchos años y que no sabía qué era lo que había pasado, pero que no parecía ser nada bueno. La anciana, que había estado observándome con una mezcla de curiosidad y miedo, se acercó a mí y me preguntó si quería un poco de té. Me senté en la mesa de la cocina, y mientras ella preparaba el té, el posadero se fue a la habitación de al lado, murmurando algo sobre que tenía que hacer una llamada. La ancilla me miró con una expresión seria y me dijo que no sabía qué estaba pasando, pero que parecía que había algo muy importante en juego. Me miré a mi alrededor y noté que la casa parecía estar llena de secretos y misterios. La ancilla me preguntó si quería saber qué pasaba, pero antes de que pudiera responder, el posadero regresó con una expresión sombríaa y me dijo que el conde había llegado y que estaba en la habitación de arriba. Me pidió que subiera a verlo, pero antes de que pudiera subir, oí un ruido extraño proveniente de la habitación de al lado. Me di la vuelta para ver qué era, y vi que la ancilla estaba mirando hacia la habitación con una expresión de miedo. Me pregunté qué pasaba, pero antes de que pudiera preguntarle, la ancilla se fue corriendo hacia la habitación de al lado, murmurando algo sobre que tenía que ir a buscar algo. Me quedé solo en la cocina, sintiendo una sensación de inquietud y curiosidad. ¿Qué pasaba en esa casa? ¿Qué quería el conde? ¿Y qué había detrás de todo ese misterio? Me senté en la mesa, esperando a que alguien me explicara lo que estaba pasando, pero la ancilla no regresó. La casa se quedó en silencio, y solo se escuchaba el ruido de las campanas de la iglesia de la ciudad, que sonaban a la hora de la siesta. Me quedé sentado allí, sintiendo que algo estaba a punto de estallar, y que yo estaba en el centro de todo. La puerta de la habitación de al lado se abrió, y la ancilla salió con una expresión sombríaa. Me dijo que el conde quería verme, y que tenía que subir a la habitación de arriba. Me levanté de la mesa, sintiendo una sensación de nerviosismo, y seguí a la ancilla hacia la habitación de arriba. Al llegar allí, vi al conde sentado en una silla, con una expresión seria y preocupada. Me dijo que había estado esperando por mí, y que tenía algo importante que decirme. Me senté en la silla que me indicó, sintiendo que algo importante estaba a punto de pasar. El conde se me acercó y me dijo que había estado investigando sobre mí, y que había descubierto algo que me iba a cambiar la vida para siempre. en_first_half: 4 May.—I found that my landlord had got a letter from the Count, directing him to secure the best place on the coach for me; but on making inquiries as to details he seemed somewhat reticent, and pretended that he could not understand my German. This could not be true, because up to then he had understood it perfectly; at least, he answered my questions exactly as if he did. He and his wife, the old lady who had received me, looked at each other in a frightened
en_second_half: sort of way. He mumbled out that the money had been sent in a letter, and that was all he knew. When I asked him if he knew Count Dracula, and could tell me anything of his castle, both he and his wife crossed themselves, and, saying that they knew nothing at all, simply refused to speak further. It was so near the time of starting that I had no time to ask any one else, for it was all very mysterious and not by any means comforting.

es_first_half: 4 de mayo. Averigüé que mi posadero había recibido una carta del conde, ordenándole que asegurara el mejor lugar del coche para mí; pero al inquirir acerca de los detalles, se mostró un tanto reticente y pretendió no poder entender mi alemán. Esto no podía ser cierto, porque hasta esos momentos lo había entendido perfectamente; por lo menos respondía a mis preguntas exactamente como si las entendiera. Él y su mujer, la anciana que me había recibido, se miraron con temor. Él murmuró que
es_second_half: el dinero le había sido enviado en una carta, y que era todo lo que sabía. Cuando le pregunté si conocía al Conde Drácula y si podía decirme algo de su castillo, tanto él como su mujer se persignaron, y diciendo que no sabían nada de nada, se negaron simplemente a decir nada más. Era ya tan cerca a la hora de la partida que no tuve tiempo de preguntarle a nadie más, pero todo me parecía muy misterioso y de ninguna manera tranquilizante.
es_results_raw: había estado trabajando en la casa durante muchos años y que no sabía qué era lo que había pasado, pero que no parecía ser nada bueno. Me senté en la mesa de la cocina, y mientras ella preparaba el té, el posadero se fue a la habitación de al lado, murmurando algo sobre que tenía que hacer una llamada. La ancilla me miró con una expresión seria y me dijo que no sabía qué estaba pasando, pero que parecía que había algo muy importante en juego. Me miré a mi alrededor y noté que la casa parecía estar llena de secretos y misterios. La ancilla se acercó a mí de nuevo y me dijo que si quería saber qué pasaba, tenía que ser paciente y esperar a que el posadero regresara. Me senté en silencio, esperando a que el posadero regresara y me explicara qué estaba pasando. Pasaron varios minutos, y finalmente el posadero regresó con una expresión seria en el rostro. Me miró con una mezcla de miedo y respeto y me dijo que había algo que tenía que decirme, algo que podría cambiar todo. Me senté en la silla, preparado para escuchar lo que iba a decirme. El posadero se aclaró la garganta y comenzó a hablar en un tono bajo y serio.

en_second_half: with a charming smile, he handed it to me to read. One passage of it, at least, gave me a thrill of pleasure.
en_results_raw: his eyes widened in surprise, and a mixture of emotions crossed his face, but he quickly regained his composure, folded the letter, and handed it back to me, instructing me to wait for a response from him, which would take a few hours, and in the meantime, he asked me to take a seat and make myself comfortable in the study, where a warm fire was crackling in the fireplace, casting a warm glow over the room, and the scent of old books and leather filled the air, as I sat down in one of the plush armchairs, trying to make sense of the situation, and wondering what could be the contents of the letter that had caused such a reaction from Mr. Smith, who was now pacing back and forth in front of the fireplace, deep in thought, his brow furrowed in concentration, and his eyes fixed on some point in the distance, as if lost in a world of his own, and I couldn't help but wonder what secrets lay hidden behind his enigmatic expression, and what the outcome of this mysterious letter would be, as the minutes ticked by at a glacial pace, and the silence in the room was only broken by the occasional crackle of the fire, and the soft ticking of the grandfather clock on the wall, which seemed to be counting down the seconds until the response would arrive, and I could finally get some answers, but for now, I was left with nothing but questions, and a growing sense of unease, as the anticipation hung in the air like a palpable force, and I couldn't help but feel that I was on the cusp of something big, something that would change everything, and I was both excited and terrified at the prospect, as I sat there, frozen in anticipation, waiting for the next move, and the response that would set everything in motion.

es_first_half: Le entregué la carta sellada que el señor Hawkins me había encargado. Él la abrió y la leyó seriamente; luego, con
es_second_half: una encantadora sonrisa, me la dio para que yo la leyera. Por lo menos un pasaje de ella me proporcionó gran placer:
es_results_raw: un gesto de sorpresa en el rostro, se acercó a la ventana y miró hacia fuera, como si buscara algo en la distancia. Después de un momento, volvió a la carta y la leyó de nuevo, esta vez con una expresión cada vez más seria. Su mano izquierda se crispó en el borde de la mesa, y su ceño se frunció en una línea profunda. La habitación se había vuelto silenciosa, como si el tiempo mismo hubiera detenido su curso. El señor Hawkins parecía estar sumido en un mundo de pensamientos sombríos, y yo no podía evitar sentir una sensación de inquietud en el estómago. ¿Qué había en esa carta que había provocado tal reacción en él? ¿Qué secreto había en esas palabras escritas en el papel que lo había dejado tan abrumado? Me pregunté a mí mismo mientras observaba al señor Hawkins, que seguía sentado en silencio, con la mirada perdida en el vacío.

en_first_half: I had hardly come to this conclusion when I heard the great door below shut, and knew that the Count had returned. He did not come at once into the library, so I went cautiously to my own room and found him making the bed. This was odd, but only confirmed what I had all along thought—that there were no servants in the house. When later I saw him through the chink of the hinges of the door laying the table in the dining-room, I was assured of it; for if he does himself all these menial offices, surely it is proof that there is no one else to do them. This gave me a fright, for if there is no one else in the castle, it must have been the Count himself who was the driver of the coach that brought me here. This is a terrible thought; for if so, what does it mean that he could control the wolves, as he did, by only holding up his hand in silence. How was it that all the
en_second_half: people at Bistritz and on the coach had some terrible fear for me? What meant the giving of the crucifix, of the garlic, of the wild rose, of the mountain ash? Bless that good, good woman who hung the crucifix round my neck! for it is a comfort and a strength to me whenever I touch it. It is odd that a thing which I have been taught to regard with disfavour and as idolatrous should in a time of loneliness and trouble be of help. Is it that there is something in the essence of the thing itself, or that it is a medium, a tangible help, in conveying memories of sympathy and comfort? Some time, if it may be, I must examine this matter and try to make up my mind about it. In the meantime I must find out all I can about Count Dracula, as it may help me to understand. To-night he may talk of himself, if I turn the conversation that way. I must be very careful, however, not to awake his suspicion.
vi_first_half: Đang mải suy nghĩ, tôi chợt nghe thấy có tiếng khép cửa phía dưới: lão bá tước đã về. Lão không đi ngay vào thư viện. Tôi phải rón rén trở về phòng mình. Tôi rất ngạc nhiên khi thấy lão đã ở trong đó dọn giường cho tôi! Dù vô cùng kinh ngạc, nhưng điều đó đã giúp tôi khẳng định chắc chắn một điều mà từ khi đặt chân đến lâu đài này đến giờ tôi vẫn nghi ngờ: trong nhà không có người giúp việc. Và lát sau, khi nhìn qua khe cửa, thấy lão đang bày bàn ăn trong phòng ăn, thì tôi chẳng còn gì để mà nghi ngờ nữa, bởi nếu lão có đảm nhận những việc này, thì chẳng qua là lão không có người hầu làm giúp. Tôi rùng mình hoảng sợ khi nghĩ rằng nếu trong lâu đài không còn bất cứ một ai khác, thì gã đánh xe ngựa đón tôi đến đây cũng chính là lão chứ không phải ai khác. Nếu đó đúng là sự thật, thì cái quyền lực mà lão đã làm bằng cách giơ bàn tay lên để buộc đàn sói phải tuân lệnh sẽ nói lên điều gì? Tại sao những người dân ở khách sạn Bistritz và tất cả những người bạn đồng hành trên chiếc xe ngựa đầu tiên lại luôn lo sợ cho tôi đến như vậy? Tại sao họ lại tặng

Bởi cứ mỗi lần sờ vào cây thánh giá ấy là tôi lại thấy mình như được tiếp thêm sức mạnh và lòng can đảm. Tôi rất ngạc nhiên khi thấy cây thánh giá, một vật vô tri vô giác, một vật mà tôi vẫn cho là vô dụng bấy lâu nay, một vật chỉ được xem là biểu tượng của tín ngưỡng, lại ít nhiều cứu giúp tôi khỏi cái cảm giác đơn côi và cùng quẫn. Cây thánh giá nhỏ ấy có một quyền năng nội tại, hay chỉ là một vật làm sống lại những kỷ niệm xưa cũ? Tôi hy vọng là có một ngày, tôi sẽ kiểm nghiệm được vấn đề để đưa ra một lời giải đáp. es_first_half: Apenas había llegado a esta conclusión cuando oí que la gran puerta de abajo se cerraba, y supe que el conde había regresado. No llegó de inmediato a la biblioteca, por lo que yo cautelosamente regresé a mi cuarto, y lo encontré arreglándome la cama. Esto era raro, pero sólo confirmó lo que yo ya había estado sospechando durante bastante tiempo: en la casa no había sirvientes. Cuando después lo vi a través de la hendidura de los goznes de la puerta arreglando la mesa en el comedor, ya no tuve ninguna duda; pues si él se encargaba de hacer todos aquellos oficios minúsculos, seguramente era la prueba de que no había nadie más en el castillo, y el mismo conde debió haber sido el cochero que me trajo en la calesa hasta aquí. Esto es un pensamiento terrible; pues si es así, significa que puede controlar a los lobos, tal como lo hizo, por el solo hecho de levantar la mano en silencio. ¿Por qué habrá sido que toda
es_second_half: la gente en Bistritz y en el coche sentían tanto temor por mí? ¿Qué significado le daban al crucifijo, al ajo, a la rosa salvaje, al fresno de montaña? ¡Bendita sea aquella buena mujer que me colgó el crucifijo alrededor del cuello! Me da consuelo y fuerza cada vez que lo toco. Es divertido que una cosa a la cual me enseñaron que debía ver con desagrado y como algo idolátrico pueda ser de ayuda en tiempo de soledad y problemas. ¿Es que hay algo en la esencia misma de la cosa, o es que es un medio, una ayuda tangible que evoca el recuerdo de simpatías y consuelos? Puede ser que alguna vez deba examinar este asunto y tratar de decirme acerca de él. Mientras tanto debo averiguar todo lo que pueda sobre el conde Drácula, pues eso me puede ayudar a comprender. Esta noche lo haré que hable sobre él mismo, volteando la conversación en esa dirección. Sin embargo, debo ser muy cuidadoso para no despertar sus sospechas.
es_results_raw: ¿Por qué habrá sido que toda esta casa estuviera tan vacía y silenciosa? ¿Será que el conde ha estado encerrado en este lugar durante años, sin que nadie lo haya visto ni haya sabido de su existencia? Me sentí un escalofrío al pensar en la posibilidad de que estuviera solo en este lugar, rodeado de la oscuridad y la soledad. Me pregunté a mí mismo si sería posible que alguien hubiera estado aquí antes que yo, alguien que hubiera sido víctima de la misma trampa que yo, y que hubiera sido sometido a la voluntad del conde.

El anciano se detuvo en un punto en particular, miró hacia arriba y luego hacia abajo, como si estuviera pensando en algo. Luego, se volvió hacia mí y me preguntó si sabía qué era ese lugar. Le dije que no, y él sonrió y me dijo que era un lugar especial, un lugar donde se reunían los ancianos para compartir historias y consejos. Me invitó a acompañarlo, pero yo me excusé, diciendo que tenía que seguir adelante. El anciano asintió con la cabeza y se despidió, y yo seguí mi camino, pensando en lo que había dicho. ¿Qué podría ser ese lugar? ¿Qué historias y consejos se compartían allí? Me pregunté a mí mismo mientras continuaba mi camino, pero no encontré respuestas. Llegué a la iglesia y me senté en un banco, esperando a que el servicio comenzara. Mientras esperaba, observé a la gente que entraba y salía, cada uno con su propia historia y motivación. Algunos parecían estar buscando consuelo, otros parecían estar buscando conexión. Me pregunté qué les pasaría a los ancianos que se reunían en los graderíos. ¿Qué les pasaría a las historias y consejos que compartían? ¿Qué les pasaría a los que se quedaban atrás? Las preguntas se me pasaron por la mente mientras esperaba a que el servicio comenzara, pero no encontré respuestas. El servicio comenzó, y la iglesia se llenó de la música y la voz del predicador. Me sentí pequeño y insignificante en medio de la multitud, pero al mismo tiempo, me sentí conectado a todos los demás, unidos por nuestra búsqueda de respuestas y significado. El servicio terminó, y la iglesia se vació. Me quedé sentado, reflexionando sobre lo que había visto y oído. Me pregunté qué había aprendido, y qué había perdido. Me pregunté qué había visto en los graderíos, y qué había visto en la iglesia. Las preguntas se me pasaron por la mente, y no encontré respuestas. Pero sabía que seguiría preguntando, seguiría buscando, y seguiría creyendo. Porque en la búsqueda de respuestas y significado, encontré algo más valioso: la conexión con los demás, y la conexión con mí mismo.

He spat on the ground, his disgust evident in his actions. "The relatives will be ashamed, not pleased," he continued, his voice dripping with disdain. "They will be reminded of the deceit and the pain that their ancestors brought upon this land. The weight of their secrets will be crushing, and they will be forced to confront the lies that have been hidden for so long. The relatives will be reminded of the blood that was spilled, the lives that were lost, and the families that were torn apart. They will be forced to confront the truth, no matter how painful it may be. And that, my friend, is not something to be taken lightly." He paused, his eyes scanning the surrounding area as if searching for something, or someone. "But I fear it may already be too late. The truth has a way of surfacing, and once it does, there is no going back. The relatives will be forced to face the consequences of their ancestors' actions, and it will not be a pleasant experience." He fell silent, lost in thought, as the weight of his words hung in the air like a challenge, daring anyone to disagree. The silence was oppressive, and it seemed to be suffocating, making it hard to breathe. The only sound was the distant rumble of thunder, a reminder that the storm was brewing, and it would soon be upon us. The air was electric with anticipation, and the atmosphere was charged with an almost palpable sense of foreboding. The truth was coming, and it would change everything. es_first_half: 11 a. m. Mi asistente acaba de venir a verme para decirme que Renfield está muy enfermo y que ha vomitado muchas plumas.
es_second_half: "Mi creencia es, doctor -me dijo-, que se ha comido todos sus pájaros, ¡y que se los ha comido así crudos, sin más!".
es_results_raw: Ha salido corriendo de la habitación con un aspecto muy alarmante, y mi asistente me ha dicho que no ha podido calmarlo. Me he levantado de la cama y he ido a ver a Renfield, que está tumbado en el suelo, con la cara cubierta de plumas y un aspecto de total desesperación. Me ha pedido que le traiga un vaso de agua, pero no sé si es una buena idea, ya que no sé qué le ha causado este estado. Mi asistente ha sugerido que podría ser una reacción alérgica a las plumas, pero no estoy seguro. Me preocupa que pueda ser algo más grave, como una infección o una reacción alérgica grave. Me he ofrecido a llamar a un médico, pero Renfield ha negado enfáticamente, diciendo que no necesita ayuda. Me preocupa que pueda estar en peligro, y no sé qué hacer para ayudarlo.

en_first_half: On 17 July, yesterday, one of the men, Olgaren, came to my cabin, and in an awestruck way confided to me that he thought there was a strange man aboard the ship. He said that in his watch he had been sheltering behind the deck-house, as there was a rain-storm, when he saw a tall, thin man, who was not like any
en_second_half: of the crew, come up the companion-way, and go along the deck forward, and disappear. He followed cautiously, but when he got to bows found no one, and the hatchways were all closed. He was in a panic of superstitious fear, and I am afraid the panic may spread. To allay it, I shall to-day search entire ship carefully from stem to stern.
en_results_raw: The man was not like any of the crew, and Olgaren was certain that he had not seen him before. He described him as having a pale face, sunken eyes, and a black hat that was pulled low over his forehead. Olgaren said that the man seemed to be watching the ship's movements with great interest, and that he had been seen talking to some of the sailors in hushed tones. At first, Olgaren thought it was just his imagination, but as the night wore on, he became more and more convinced that there was something unusual about this stranger. He decided to confide in me, and I listened intently as he recounted his story. I must admit, I was skeptical at first, but as Olgaren spoke, I began to feel a shiver run down my spine. Could it be that we were not alone on this ship after all? I asked Olgaren if he had seen the stranger's face clearly, and he nodded, saying that he had gotten a good look at him. He described the man's eyes as being an unsettling shade of blue, and his nose as being slightly crooked. I asked Olgaren if he had told anyone else about this, and he said that he had only spoken to me and one of the other sailors, a gruff old man named Grimbold. I made a mental note to speak to Grimbold and see if he had seen anything unusual. As I listened to Olgaren's story, I couldn't shake the feeling that something was off about this ship. The wind was picking up, and the rain was starting to let up, but I could sense a growing unease in the air. I decided to keep a close eye on the crew and see if I could uncover any more information about this mysterious stranger. Little did I know, this was only the beginning of a strange and terrifying journey.

Some of them were already making their way to the dock, where a group of sailors were gathered, discussing the severity of the storm and the impact it had had on the harbour. The harbour master was standing on the dock, his face stern and worried as he surveyed the scene before him. He was talking to a group of officials, who were nodding and taking notes as he explained the situation. The harbour was in disarray, with debris scattered everywhere and several boats damaged or destroyed. The storm had been a fierce one, and it would take some time to clean up the mess and assess the full extent of the damage. As we walked along the harbour, we saw a group of people gathered around a small boat that had been washed up on the shore. They were trying to free it from the rocks, but it was stuck fast. We watched for a while, then moved on, continuing our walk along the harbour. The storm may have passed, but the aftermath would be felt for days to come.

El viento soplaba con fuerza, haciendo que las olas se elevaran aún más, y el sonido de las olas contra la costa era como un rugido constante que parecía acompañar cada movimiento del mar. Mientras observábamos la escena, un grupo de pescadores locales salió de una de las casas de madera que había cerca del puerto, y comenzaron a preparar sus barcos para zarpar hacia el mar. Parecían estar esperando algo, pero no sabíamos qué. El ambiente estaba cargado de expectativa, y el silencio que había caído sobre la playa era solo interrumpido por el sonido de las olas y el viento. De repente, uno de los pescadores se acercó a nosotros y nos dijo algo en voz baja, y vimos que su rostro estaba lleno de preocupación. "¿Qué pasa?", preguntamos, pero antes de que pudiera responder, un barco salió del puerto y se dirigió hacia el mar, con una velocidad que parecía imposible. El barco se alejó rápidamente, y el pescador nos miró con una expresión seria y nos dijo: "Es el barco de la pesca de la ballena. Han salido a buscarla, pero no sé si volverán a regresar". El pescador se alejó rápidamente, dejándonos con la sensación de que algo importante estaba a punto de suceder. El viento seguía soplando con fuerza, y las olas seguían rugiendo contra la costa, pero ahora parecían más amenazantes que nunca. El sol seguía brillando, pero su luz parecía ser apenas un débil intento de calmar el ambiente de tensión que se había creado en la playa. El silencio que había caído sobre la playa parecía ser un preludio a algo grande, algo que iba a cambiar todo. Y en ese momento, no sabíamos qué iba a suceder, pero sabíamos que nuestra vida iba a cambiar para siempre.

en_first_half: When I bent over her I could see that she was still asleep. Her lips were parted, and she was breathing—not softly as usual with her, but in long, heavy gasps, as though striving to get her lungs full at every breath. As I came close, she put up her hand in her sleep and pulled the collar of her nightdress close around her throat. Whilst she did so there came a little shudder through her, as though she felt the cold. I flung the warm shawl over her, and drew the edges tight round her neck, for I dreaded lest she should get some deadly chill from the night air, unclad as she was. I feared to wake her all at once, so, in order to have my hands free that I might help her, I fastened the shawl at her throat with a big safety-pin; but I must have been clumsy in my anxiety and pinched or pricked her with it, for by-and-by, when her breathing became quieter, she put her hand to her throat again and moaned. When I had her carefully wrapped up I put my shoes on her feet and then began very gently to wake her. At first she did not respond; but gradually she became more and
en_second_half: more uneasy in her sleep, moaning and sighing occasionally. At last, as time was passing fast, and, for many other reasons, I wished to get her home at once, I shook her more forcibly, till finally she opened her eyes and awoke. She did not seem surprised to see me, as, of course, she did not realise all at once where she was. Lucy always wakes prettily, and even at such a time, when her body must have been chilled with cold, and her mind somewhat appalled at waking unclad in a churchyard at night, she did not lose her grace. She trembled a little, and clung to me; when I told her to come at once with me home she rose without a word, with the obedience of a child. As we passed along, the gravel hurt my feet, and Lucy noticed me wince. She stopped and wanted to insist upon my taking my shoes; but I would not. However, when we got to the pathway outside the churchyard, where there was a puddle of water, remaining from the storm, I daubed my feet with mud, using each foot in turn on the other, so that as we went home, no one, in case we should meet any one, should notice my bare feet.

Al acercarme, subió la mano y tiró del cuello de su camisón de dormir, como si sintiera frío. Sin embargo, siguió dormida. Yo puse el caliente chal sobre sus hombros, amarrándole fuertemente las puntas alrededor del cuello, pues temía mucho que fuese a tomar un mortal resfrío del aire de la noche, así casi desnuda como estaba. Temí despertarla de golpe, por lo que, para poder tener mis manos libres para ayudarla, le sujeté el chal cerca de la garganta con un imperdible de gran tamaño; pero en mi ansiedad debo haber obrado torpemente y la pinché con él, porque al poco rato, cuando su respiración se hizo más regular, se llevó otra vez la mano a la garganta y gimió. Una vez que la hube envuelto cuidadosamente, puse mis zapatos en sus pies y comencé a despertarla con mucha suavidad. en_first_half: 18 August.—I am happy to-day, and write sitting on the seat in the churchyard. Lucy is ever so much better. Last night she slept well all night, and did not disturb me once. The roses seem coming back already to her cheeks, though she is still sadly pale and wan-looking. If she were in any way anæmic I could understand it, but she is not. She
en_second_half: is in gay spirits and full of life and cheerfulness. All the morbid reticence seems to have passed from her, and she has just reminded me, as if I needed any reminding, of that night, and that it was here, on this very seat, I found her asleep. As she told me she tapped playfully with the heel of her boot on the stone slab and said:—

es_first_half: 18 de agosto. Hoy estoy muy contenta, y escribo sentada en el asiento del cementerio de la iglesia. Lucy está mucho mejor. Anoche durmió bien toda la noche, y no me molestó ni una vez. Parece que ya las rosas regresan a sus mejillas, aunque todavía está tristemente pálida y descolorida. Yo entendería su situación si estuviera anémica, pero no es el caso. Está
es_second_half: de muy buen humor, y llena de vida y alegría. Toda aquella mórbida reticencia parece haberla abandonado, y hace justamente un momento me recordó, como si yo necesitara que me la recordaran, aquella noche, y lo que sucedió aquí, en este mismo asiento, donde la encontré dormida. Al tiempo que me hablaba taconeaba juguetonamente con el tacón de su bota sobre la lápida, y dijo:
es_results_raw: enferma, y no sé qué hacer para ayudarla. La pobre niña ha estado enferma durante tanto tiempo, y su madre está muy preocupada. Me pregunto si debería ir a buscar al médico, pero no sé si es necesario. Quizás sea solo una simple gripe, y en ese caso, no hay nada que hacer más que esperar a que se recupere. Pero si es algo más grave, entonces necesitamos buscar ayuda de inmediato. Me siento tan impotente, sentada aquí en este cementerio, sin saber qué hacer para ayudar a mi querida amiga. La iglesia está vacía y silenciosa a mi alrededor, y solo puedo escuchar el sonido de las gotas de lluvia que caen sobre el suelo. Me pregunto si la lluvia puede ser un buen augurio, un signo de que pronto se recuperará Lucy. Pero no puedo evitar sentirme inquieta y preocupada por su bienestar. Me gustaría poder hacer algo más, pero por ahora, solo puedo sentarme aquí y esperar a que la mañana llegue.

Hâlâ üzücü derecede solgun ve bitkin görünse de yanaklarına güller geri gelmiş gibi. Eğer anemisi olsaydı, bunu anlayabilirdim,
tr_second_half: ama öyle değil. Neşesi yerinde, yaşam ve keyif dolu. I recall the words of my dear friend, Dr. Smith, who warned me about the dangers of relying on chloral for a quick escape from reality. He said that it's a temporary solution, a mere Band-Aid on a deeper wound. I must try to find a more permanent cure for my melancholy, one that doesn't involve numbing my senses or dulling my mind. Perhaps a long walk in the moonlight, a change of scenery, or a stimulating conversation with someone who truly understands me. But for now, I shall try to clear my head and focus on the present moment, letting go of the what-ifs and maybes that plague me. en_first_half: “No,” I said. “I waited till I had seen you, as I said in my telegram. I wrote him a letter simply
en_second_half: telling him that you were coming, as Miss Westenra was not so well, and that I should let him know if need be.”
en_results_raw: explaining the situation and asking him to meet me at the station. I had to wait for hours, but I was determined to see him and clear up the misunderstanding. The train was late, and I was starting to get anxious, but finally, it pulled in, and I saw him standing on the platform, looking worried and a bit disheveled. I rushed towards him, and we exchanged a warm embrace, relieved to have finally found each other after all the uncertainty. As we walked out of the station, the bright sunlight and the sound of the city came as a welcome respite from the tension and confusion of the past few days. We hailed a taxi and headed towards the hotel, eager to start our conversation and put everything behind us. The driver, a gruff but kind-eyed man, asked us where we were headed, and I explained the situation to him, trying to keep my voice steady and composed. He nodded sympathetically and drove us to the hotel in silence, the only sound being the hum of the engine and the occasional honk of a car horn. When we arrived, we paid the driver and stepped out, taking a deep breath of the cool evening air. The hotel lobby was bustling with people, but we managed to find a quiet corner where we could sit and talk without being overheard. I took a deep breath and began to explain everything to him, trying to make sense of the events that had led us to this point. He listened intently, his eyes never leaving mine, and I could see the understanding and forgiveness in them. As we talked, the tension between us began to dissipate, and I felt a sense of relief wash over me. We talked for hours, discussing everything and nothing, our conversation flowing easily and naturally. The world outside seemed to fade away, and all that mattered was the two of us, lost in our own little bubble of understanding and connection. It was as if time had stood still, and all that existed was this moment, right here and now. And in that moment, I knew that everything would be okay, that we would get through this together, as long as we had each other. The uncertainty and fear that had gripped me just hours before began to lift, replaced by a sense of hope and renewal. I felt a weight lift off my shoulders, and my heart swelled with gratitude for this second chance. We sat there for a long time, holding hands and talking, the world outside slowly coming back into focus. Eventually, we stood up, and I took his hand, feeling a sense of determination and purpose. We were going to face whatever came next, together, as a team. And as we walked out of the hotel, into the bright lights of the city, I knew that we would be okay, that we would make it through anything as long as we had each other.

en_first_half: I went downstairs with him, and as we were going there was a knock at the hall-door. When we reached the hall
en_second_half: the maid had just opened the door, and Arthur was stepping quickly in. He rushed up to me, saying in an eager whisper:—
en_results_raw: door, my mother was already there, opening it to reveal a tall, dark-haired man with a kind smile, who introduced himself as our neighbor, Mr. Johnson, and explained that he had come to invite us to a barbecue at his place that evening, and as we exchanged pleasantries, I couldn't help but notice the way the sunlight streaming through the window highlighted the faint lines on his face, a testament to a life well-lived, and I felt a pang of curiosity about this man who seemed to be a pillar of our community, and my mother, ever the gracious host, accepted the invitation on our behalf, and as we chatted, I found myself wondering what it would be like to attend this barbecue, and what stories Mr. Johnson might share, and whether we would meet any other interesting people, and as we said our goodbyes, I felt a sense of excitement building, and I couldn't wait to see what the evening had in store for us.
vi_first_half: Hai chúng tôi đang xuống dưới chân cầu thang thì nghe có tiếng gõ cửa. Người giúp việc chạy
vi_second_half: ra mở cửa, thì ra là Arthur. Anh ta đi vội về phía tôi, giọng thổn thức vì âu lo:
vi_results_raw: đến mở cửa, nhìn qua chớp mắt rồi lại đóng lại. Chúng tôi nhìn vào nhau, không biết người mở cửa là ai. Người giúp việc lại mở cửa lần nữa, lần này ánh sáng từ trong nhà chiếu vào, và chúng tôi thấy một người đàn ông mặc áo choàng, đứng ở cửa, nhìn vào chúng tôi với một nụ cười nhẹ nhàng.
es_first_half: Lo acompañé escaleras abajo, y al tiempo que bajábamos alguien llamó a la puerta del corredor. Cuando llegamos a él,
es_second_half: la sirvienta acababa de abrir la puerta y Arthur estaba entrando velozmente. Corrió hacia mí, hablando en un susurro angustioso.
es_results_raw: abrió la puerta y nos miró con una expresión seria. "¿Qué es lo que está pasando?", preguntó, notando la preocupación en mis ojos. Le expliqué la situación y él asintió con la cabeza, "Sí, sé de lo que se trata. Es un problema grave, pero no hay tiempo que perder. Tenemos que actuar rápidamente si queremos solucionarlo antes de que sea demasiado tarde."

en_first_half: Lucy chatted with me freely, and seemed quite unconscious that anything had happened. I tried to keep her amused and interested.
en_second_half: When her mother came up to see her, she did not seem to notice any change whatever, but said to me gratefully:—
en_results_raw: She laughed at my jokes, and even managed to muster up a smile when I showed her a funny video on my phone. As the hours passed, I began to feel a sense of relief wash over me, thinking that maybe she was going to be okay. But as the sun started to set, casting a warm orange glow over the room, I couldn't shake the feeling that something was still off. Her eyes seemed a little too glassy, her smile a little too forced. I tried to brush it off as mere paranoia, but the nagging sense of unease lingered, refusing to be silenced.
vi_first_half: Lucy lại hồn nhiên nói chuyện dài dài với tôi, hình như cô vẫn không hề hay biết gì về chuyện vừa xảy ra. Tôi cố gắng làm cho cô vui, cuốn hút cô vào hết chuyện này đến chuyện khác. Và khi mẹ cô bước vào thăm, tôi tin
vi_second_half: là bà cũng không nhận ra bất cứ một sự thay đổi nào nơi cô. — Chúng tôi thật chẳng biết làm gì để cảm ơn tất cả những gì mà hai thầy trò đã làm cho chúng tôi? - Bà nói với tôi bằng một giọng biết ơn sâu sắc.
vi_results_raw: tin rằng cô ấy sẽ không thể phát hiện ra được gì. Nhưng mẹ của Lucy lại có một cái nhìn khác, một cái nhìn sâu sắc và tinh tế. Cô nhìn tôi một cách nghiêm khắc, nhưng không nói gì. Thay vào đó, cô ngồi xuống cạnh Lucy và bắt đầu trò chuyện với cô một cách nhẹ nhàng. Tôi thấy Lucy bắt đầu mở lòng, nói về những điều mà cô thường không nói với ai. Mẹ của cô lắng nghe chăm chú, không để ý đến tôi, nhưng tôi biết rằng cô đang cố gắng hiểu rõ hơn về tình huống. Sau một lúc, mẹ của Lucy đứng dậy và nói với tôi: "Cậu có thể đi bây giờ, tôi sẽ xử lý mọi thứ." Tôi cảm thấy một chút thất vọng, nhưng cũng biết rằng tôi đã làm được điều mình cần. Tôi rời đi, để lại mẹ và Lucy một mình. Tôi không biết họ sẽ nói gì, nhưng tôi tin rằng họ sẽ tìm ra được sự thật.
es_first_half: Lucy conversó conmigo alegremente, y parecía completamente inconsciente de lo
es_second_half: que había sucedido. Yo traté de mantenerla entretenida e interesada.
es_results_raw: que estaba a punto de suceder, pero yo sabía que pronto iba a ser un día muy difícil para ella, y que su felicidad no duraría mucho tiempo.

tr_results_raw: Ancak o, bir şekilde beni göremeyeceğini bilmek beni daha da cesaretlendiriyordu. Onun yüz ifadesini gördüğümde, bir an için endişelenmek istedim ama sonra kendimi toparladım ve onunla konuşmaya devam ettim. Konuşurken, onunla daha iyi bağ kurmaya çalıştım ve onunla daha derinlemesine sohbet etmenin yollarını arıyordum.

en_first_half: 13 September.—Called at the Berkeley and found Van Helsing, as usual, up to time. The carriage ordered
en_second_half: from the hotel was waiting. The Professor took his bag, which he always brings with him now.
en_results_raw: was sent to the station to meet the 8 o'clock train, and we drove to the hotel, where we found the Professor in a state of some agitation, his brow furrowed with worry and his eyes fixed intently on the clock on the mantlepiece.
vi_first_half: • Ngày 13 tháng 9 Tới Berkeley, tôi thấy Van Helsing đã đứng đợi tôi từ lúc nào. Chiếc xe do khách sạn
vi_second_half: gọi hộ chúng tôi đang đậu ở trước cửa. Như thường lệ, hôm nay ông cũng mang theo chiếc túi đựng đồ lề.
vi_results_raw: đến cung cấp, ông ta đã mặc một bộ trang phục tối tăm, với chiếc áo choàng đen và chiếc mũ rộng, khiến tôi không thể nhận ra được khuôn mặt của ông. Tôi cảm thấy một luồng gió lạnh chạy dọc theo lưng khi ông ta bước ra khỏi xe, mắt ông ta nhìn thẳng vào tôi với một ánh nhìn lạnh lùng. "Chúng ta cần phải nói chuyện, không?" ông ta nói với giọng nói thấp và nghiêm khắc. Tôi cảm thấy một luồng sợ hãi lan tỏa trong lòng khi tôi nhìn thấy ánh mắt của ông ta, nhưng tôi cố gắng giữ bình tĩnh và hỏi: "Về cái gì, ông?"
es_first_half: 13 de septiembre. Pasé por el Berkeley y encontré a van Helsing, como de costumbre, ya preparado para
es_second_half: salir. El coche ordenado por el hotel estaba esperando. El profesor tomó su maletín, que ahora siempre lleva consigo.
es_results_raw: un viaje largo, con su maleta llena de provisiones y su espada a punto de ser sacada de su funda. Me di cuenta de que llevaba consigo un mapa detallado de la región, con varias notas y marcadores en lugares específicos. Parecía que estaba buscando algo en particular, pero no estaba seguro de qué era. Me acerqué a él y le pregunté qué estaba haciendo, pero solo me sonrió y me dijo que estaba a punto de descubrir algo importante. Me invito a unirse a él, pero le dije que no, ya que tenía que regresar a casa. Me despedimos y me marché, pero no pude evitar sentir que algo extraño estaba a punto de ocurrir.
tr_first_half: 13 Eylül - Berkeley’ye uğradım ve Van Helsing’i her zamanki gibi tam zamanında hazırlanmış
tr_second_half: buldum. Otel tarafından çağrılan at arabası bizi bekliyordu. Profesör, artık sürekli yanında taşıdığı çantasını aldı.
tr_results_raw: bulundu. Öğleden sonra, Dr. Seward'a bir ziyarette bulundum ve onun da aynı şekilde hazırlanmış olduğunu gördüm. Bu, vampirlerin bir araya gelme planı olmalıydı. Van Helsing, bir plan geliştirmiş ve bu planı uygulamaya hazırlanıyordu. Ben de onunla birlikte çalışmaya karar verdim ve birlikte, vampirlerin peşine düşmek için yola çıktık.

en_first_half: “All right, guv’nor. This ’ere is about the ’ole story. That ’ere wolf what we called Bersicker was one of three grey ones that came from Norway to Jamrach’s, which we bought off him four years ago. He was
en_second_half: a nice well-behaved wolf, that never gave no trouble to talk of. I’m more surprised at ’im for wantin’ to get out nor any other animile in the place. But, there, you can’t trust wolves no more nor women.”
en_results_raw: was a fierce and cunning beast, with a coat as black as coal and eyes that glowed like embers in the dark. He was the leader of the pack, and the other two wolves, Grim and Fenrir, looked up to him with a mix of fear and respect. We had thought of selling him to the circus, but he was too wild and unpredictable, so we decided to keep him as a guard dog for the farm. But as the years went by, Bersicker's behavior became more and more erratic, and we started to notice strange occurrences around the farm - tools would go missing, and there were rumors of strange noises coming from the woods at night. We tried to keep an eye on him, but he was always one step ahead, and we began to suspect that he was more than just a ordinary wolf. He seemed to be watching us, waiting for the perfect moment to strike, and we knew that we had to be careful around him. But little did we know, Bersicker was just the beginning of a much larger problem, one that would threaten the very existence of our farm and our way of life.

Fido, que era un perro muy agresivo, se puso a ladrar y a morder a Bersicker, que, defendiéndose, le dio un mordisco en la oreja. El dueño de Fido, un hombre muy iracundo, se puso a gritar y a amenazar con matar a Bersicker, pero yo, que había visto la situación, me apresuré a intervenir y a explicarle que el lobo no había sido agresivo, sino que se había defendido. Finalmente, después de mucha discusión, el dueño de Fido se calmó y se disculpó conmigo. Pero, desde ese día, Bersicker se volvió muy nervioso y comenzó a mostrar signos de agresividad, especialmente hacia Fido, que siempre lo miraba con odio. A pesar de esto, yo seguía queriendo a Bersicker y lo cuidaba con mucho cariño, pero mi esposa, que siempre había sido muy sensible a la presencia de animales salvajes, comenzó a estar cada vez más asustada por la conducta de Bersicker. Un día, después de que Bersicker hubo mordido a un criado, mi esposa me pidió que lo vendiera, pero yo no quise hacerlo, ya que sabía que el lobo no era malo por naturaleza, sino que había sido provocado por la situación con Fido. Sin embargo, mi esposa se negó a vivir en la misma casa con un lobo que podía ser peligroso, y finalmente, después de mucha discusión, decidimos que lo mejor sería venderlo a un zoológico, donde podría vivir en libertad y sin causar problemas a nadie. Así que, con mucho pesar, le vendimos a Bersicker al zoológico, y aunque me sentí muy triste al despedirme de mi querido lobo, sabía que era lo mejor para todos. Pero, al día siguiente, recibí una llamada del dueño del zoológico, que me dijo que Bersicker había muerto en la noche anterior, probablemente debido a una enfermedad, y que se había comportado muy bien en su nuevo hogar. Me sentí aliviado al saber que mi querido lobo había muerto en paz, y que no había causado ningún daño a nadie. Pero, a pesar de esto, no pude evitar sentir un sentimiento de tristeza y de pérdida, ya que había sido un lobo muy especial y me había gustado mucho. Y así, con el tiempo, la memoria de Bersicker se fue apagando, pero nunca olvidé el tiempo que pasé con él en la casa, y la forma en que me enseñó a cuidar y a respetar a los animales salvajes.

en_first_half: 17 September.—I was engaged after dinner in my study posting up my books, which, through press of other work and the many visits to Lucy, had fallen sadly into arrear. Suddenly the door was burst open, and in rushed my patient, with his face distorted with passion. I was thunderstruck, for such a thing as a patient getting of his own accord into the Superintendent’s study is almost unknown. Without an instant’s pause he made straight at me. He had a dinner-knife in his hand, and, as I saw he was dangerous, I tried to keep the table between us. He was too quick and too strong for me, however; for before I could get my balance he had struck at me and cut my left wrist rather severely. Before he
en_second_half: could strike again, however, I got in my right and he was sprawling on his back on the floor. My wrist bled freely, and quite a little pool trickled on to the carpet. I saw that my friend was not intent on further effort, and occupied myself binding up my wrist, keeping a wary eye on the prostrate figure all the time. When the attendants rushed in, and we turned our attention to him, his employment positively sickened me. He was lying on his belly on the floor licking up, like a dog, the blood which had fallen from my wounded wrist. He was easily secured, and, to my surprise, went with the attendants quite placidly, simply repeating over and over again: “The blood is the life! The blood is the life!”
vi_first_half: • Ngày 17 tháng 9 Ăn tối xong, tôi quay về phòng, định bụng sẽ lên lịch cho những ngày làm việc tiếp theo. Bất thình lình, cánh cửa phòng tôi bỗng bật mở, tiếp đó là sự xuất hiện đường đột của Renfield: hắn lao thẳng về phía tôi với bộ mặt thật hung tợn. Tôi sững sờ đứng nhìn, bởi một bệnh nhân bất ngờ đến tìm bác sĩ trưởng mà không xin phép ai là một việc làm rất ít khi xảy ra ở đây. Tay hắn lăm lăm một con dao sáng loáng. Tôi ý thức ngay được rằng trong cơn điên, hắn có thể trở nên rất nguy hiểm, bởi vậy tôi phải cảnh giác lùi lại, định bụng sẽ lấy cái bàn gỗ làm chướng ngại vật ngăn cách hắn với tôi. Nhưng hắn đã nhanh hơn tôi, trước khi tôi kịp lấy lại thăng bằng, hắn đã vung tay chém tôi một nhát khá sâu vào cổ tay trái.
vi_second_half: Tuy nhiên, không để hắn vung dao lên lần thứ hai, tôi lập tức lao vào đẩy hắn ngã ngửa xuống sàn nhà. Máu từ vết thương ở tay tôi chảy túa ra thành một vũng nhỏ trên tấm thảm. Renfield vẫn nằm im, dường như không định tấn công lần nữa. Tới lúc đó tôi mới có thời gian băng bó vết thương trong khi mắt vẫn không rời khỏi gã bệnh nhân. Khi mấy tay giám thị tới, chúng tôi mới xúm lại xốc hắn dậy và đẩy hắn trở về phòng, song hắn đã giãy nảy lên và quay ngoắt lại để làm một việc khiến tôi một lần nữa phải kinh ngạc: hắn bò sát xuống sàn nhà giống như điệu bộ của một con chó, và lè lưỡi liếm sạch các vết máu vừa chảy xuống từ vết thương của tôi. Hắn vừa liếm láp vừa luôn mồm lải nhải mãi một câu: “Máu là cuộc sống? Máu là cuộc sống!”
vi_results_raw: Đến giờ tôi vẫn nhớ rõ từng chi tiết của cơn tấn công đó. Renfield đã lao vào tôi với một ánh mắt man rợ, tay cầm con dao nhọn như một con rắn đang sẵn sàng tấn công. Tôi cố gắng giữ bình tĩnh, nhưng không thể tránh khỏi cảm giác sợ hãi khi nhìn thấy con dao đó. es_first_half: 17 de septiembre. Estaba ocupado, después de cenar, en mi estudio fechando mis libros, los cuales, debido a la urgencia de otros trabajos y a las muchas visitas a Lucy, se encontraban tristemente atrasados. De pronto, la puerta se abrió de golpe y mi paciente entró como un torbellino, con el rostro deformado por la ansiedad. Yo me sobresalté, pues es una cosa casi desconocida que un paciente entre de esa manera y por su propia cuenta en el despacho del superintendente. Sin hacer ninguna pausa se dirigió directamente hacia mí. En su mano había un cuchillo de cocina, y como vi que era peligroso, traté de mantener la mesa entre nosotros. Sin embargo, fue demasiado rápido y demasiado fuerte para mí; antes de que yo pudiera alcanzar mi equilibrio me había lanzado el primer golpe, cortándome bastante
es_second_half: profundamente la muñeca izquierda. Pero antes de que pudiera lanzarme otro golpe, le di un derechazo y cayó con los brazos y piernas extendidos por el suelo. Mi muñeca sangraba profusamente, y un pequeño charco se formó sobre la alfombra. Vi que mi amigo no parecía intentar otro esfuerzo, por lo que me ocupé en vendar mi muñeca, manteniendo todo el tiempo una cautelosa vigilancia sobre la figura postrada. Cuando mis asistentes entraron corriendo y pusimos nuestra atención sobre él, su aspecto positivamente me enfermó. Estaba acostado sobre el vientre en el suelo, lamiendo como un perro la sangre que había caído de mi muñeca herida. Lo sujetamos con facilidad, y, para sorpresa mía, se dejó llevar con bastante docilidad por los asistentes, repitiendo una y otra vez: –¡La sangre es la vida! ¡La sangre es la vida!

Birdenbire kapı açıldı ve yüzü öfkeden çarpılmış hastam içeri daldı. Şaşkına döndüm, çünkü bir hastanın kendi isteğiyle Yönetici’nin odasına girdiği neredeyse hiç görülmemiş bir şeydi. en_first_half: The time did not seem long, but very, very awful, till I recovered consciousness again. Somewhere near, a passing bell was tolling; the dogs all round the neighbourhood were howling; and in our shrubbery, seemingly just outside, a nightingale was singing. I was dazed and stupid with pain and terror and weakness, but the sound of the nightingale seemed like the voice of my dead mother come back to comfort me. The sounds seemed to have awakened the maids, too, for I could hear their bare feet pattering outside my door. I called to them, and they came in, and when they saw what had happened, and what it was that lay over me on the bed, they screamed out. The wind rushed in through the broken window, and the door slammed to. They lifted off the body
en_second_half: of my dear mother, and laid her, covered up with a sheet, on the bed after I had got up. They were all so frightened and nervous that I directed them to go to the dining-room and have each a glass of wine. The door flew open for an instant and closed again. The maids shrieked, and then went in a body to the dining-room; and I laid what flowers I had on my dear mother’s breast. When they were there I remembered what Dr. Van Helsing had told me, but I didn’t like to remove them, and, besides, I would have some of the servants to sit up with me now. I was surprised that the maids did not come back. I called them, but got no answer, so I went to the dining-room to look for them.
en_results_raw: and laid it on the floor. The maids were crying and screaming, and I was still lying on the bed, trying to make sense of what had happened. One of the maids, a young girl with a pale face, was holding a candle and trying to light it, but her hands were shaking so much that she couldn't get the flame to stay lit. The other maid, a bit older and more composed, was trying to calm me down, speaking softly and telling me to stay still. But I couldn't stay still, I was in too much pain and I was trying to sit up, but the maid held me down, telling me to lie still and that help would be there soon. I tried to speak, but my voice was barely a whisper, and I could feel my life slipping away from me. The maids were trying to keep me calm, but I could see the fear in their eyes, and I knew that they were scared too. The nightingale's song had stopped, and the only sound was the wind howling outside and the maids' soft whispers. I tried to remember what had happened, but my mind was a blur, and all I could think about was the pain and the darkness that was closing in around me. The maids were trying to keep me warm, but I could feel the cold seeping in, and I knew that I was losing my battle. Just as I was starting to lose consciousness again, I heard the sound of footsteps outside, heavy and deliberate, and the maids' whispers stopped. The door creaked open, and a figure entered, its face illuminated by the faint moonlight that was filtering through the broken window. The maids gasped, and I tried to speak, but my voice was barely a whisper. The figure approached me, its eyes fixed on me, and I could feel a sense of dread wash over me. It was a woman, tall and gaunt, with a face that was deathly pale and a presence that seemed to fill the room. She reached out a bony hand and touched my forehead, and I felt a jolt of electricity run through my body. The maids gasped again, and I tried to speak, but the woman's eyes seemed to be sucking the life out of me, and I felt myself being pulled down into the darkness. The woman's face was inches from mine, and I could smell the scent of decay and rot that seemed to be emanating from her. I tried to push her away, but my body was weak and I couldn't move. The woman's eyes seemed to be burning with an otherworldly intensity, and I knew that I was in the presence of something supernatural. The maids were frozen in terror, and I could feel their fear radiating towards me. The woman's hand was still on my forehead, and I could feel her power coursing through me. I tried to scream, but my voice was barely a whisper. The woman's eyes seemed to be pulling me down into the depths of hell, and I knew that I was doomed. The maids were crying and screaming, but their voices were distant and muffled, and I was trapped in a world of darkness and despair. The woman's face was the last thing I saw before everything went black.
vi_first_half: Mặc dù bị ngất không lâu, nhưng tôi vẫn rất mơ hồ về những phút giây khủng khiếp đã trôi qua. Khi tôi tỉnh táo trở lại, âm thanh đầu tiên vẳng đến tai tôi là tiếng chuông cầu hồn ngân xa, rồi tiếp đó là tiếng chó sủa xung quanh ngôi nhà, và trong các bụi cây giữa vườn, không xa cửa sổ phòng tôi, còn vọng tới những tiếng hót lảnh lót của một con sơn ca. Nỗi ưu phiền, sự sợ hãi, tình trạng sức khỏe suy sụp nghiêm trọng, tất cả như cùng hùa tới một lúc khiến người tôi đờ ra như một kẻ chết rồi. Tuy nhiên, nghe thấy tiếng hót của chim sơn ca, tôi có cảm giác như được nghe thấy giọng nói thân thương của mẹ tôi, giọng nói dịu dàng cất lên giữa đêm tối để an ủi tôi. Chắc hẳn chuỗi tiếng động lạ tai đã làm những người hầu trong nhà thức giấc, bởi tới nghe rất rõ bước chân trần của họ nhẹ bước trên chiếu nghỉ cầu thang. vi_second_half: nỗi bất hạnh đã xảy đến với chúng tôi và trông thấy mẹ tôi nằm đè lên người tôi. Cơn gió lùa vào qua ô cửa vỡ làm cho cửa phòng thỉnh thoảng lại nghiến ken két. es_first_half: No pareció transcurrir mucho rato, sino más bien que fue muy, muy terrible, hasta que pude recobrar nuevamente la conciencia. En algún lugar cercano, una campana doblaba; todos los perros de la vecindad estaban aullando, y en nuestros arbustos, aparentemente muy cercanos, cantaba un ruiseñor. Yo estaba aturdida y embotada de dolor, terror y debilidad, pero el sonido del ruiseñor pareció la voz de mi madre muerta que regresaba para consolarme. Los ruidos parece que también despertaron a las sirvientas, pues pude oír sus pisadas descalzas corriendo fuera de mi puerta. Las llamé y entraron, y cuando vieron lo que había sucedido, y qué era lo que descansaba sobre mí en la cama, dieron gritos. El viento irrumpió a través de la rota ventana y la puerta se cerró de golpe. Levantaron el cuerpo

Las sirvientas gritaron horrorizadas, y luego se fueron en grupo compacto al comedor, y yo puse las flores que había tenido alrededor de mi cuello sobre el pecho de mi querida madre. en_first_half: Presently she woke, and I gave her food, as Van Helsing had prescribed. She took but a little, and that languidly. There did not seem to be with her now the unconscious struggle for life and strength that had hitherto so marked her illness. It struck me as curious that the moment she became conscious she pressed the garlic flowers close to
en_second_half: her. It was certainly odd that whenever she got into that lethargic state, with the stertorous breathing, she put the flowers from her; but that when she waked she clutched them close. There was no possibility of making any mistake about this, for in the long hours that followed, she had many spells of sleeping and waking and repeated both actions many times.
en_results_raw: her face, and a faint, almost imperceptible, shudder ran through her frame. I watched her closely, and it seemed to me that her eyes, though sunken and dark, held a glimmer of recognition, a spark of the woman she once was. The doctor's words echoed in my mind - "The garlic will help to purify her blood, to drive out the evil that has taken hold." I wondered if it was working, if the flowers were indeed having the desired effect. As I stood there, lost in thought, I noticed that the room had grown quiet, the only sound the soft hum of the candles and the gentle rustling of the flowers in the breeze from the open window. The stillness was oppressive, heavy with anticipation, and I couldn't shake the feeling that we were waiting for something, though I didn't know what. The minutes ticked by, each one feeling like an eternity, as I watched over the woman, my heart heavy with worry and my mind racing with questions. What was happening to her? Was the treatment working? And what lay ahead for us all? The uncertainty hung in the air, a palpable presence that seemed to grow thicker with each passing moment.
vi_first_half: Nằm thêm được một lúc nữa thì cô tỉnh dậy. Tôi cố gắng cho cô ăn một chút đúng như lời dặn của Van Helsing, cô ăn mà cứ như phải chịu một cực hình! Phải nói rằng mặc dù ngay cả cái sức lực vô thức của bản năng bây giờ cũng đã từ bỏ cô, nhưng dường như vẫn có một cái gì đó đang thôi thúc cô chiến đấu đến cùng chống lại bệnh tật và sẽ chiến thắng bệnh tật bằng mọi giá. Tôi thật sự ngạc nhiên khi thấy vừa mới tỉnh dậy, cô đã vội ôm xiết lấy tràng hoa
vi_second_half: tỏi. Tôi rất lấy làm lạ về điều này: cứ mỗi lần cô rơi vào trạng thái ngủ vùi khiến cho nhịp thở của cô trở nên rất khó nhọc là một lần cô lại đẩy tràng hoa ra xa. Después del funeral, nos reunimos en el cementerio para compartir recuerdos y reflexionar sobre la vida de las dos mujeres. Fue un momento difícil, pero también fue un recordatorio de la importancia de la familia y la amistad. Al final, nos despedimos de las dos mujeres con lágrimas en los ojos, pero también con la certeza de que su legado viviría en nuestros corazones. Chúng ta có thể sử dụng công nghệ mới để giảm thiểu tác động tiêu cực của nó, đồng thời vẫn đảm bảo hiệu suất cao. Tôi tin rằng với sự hợp tác của cả hai bên, chúng ta có thể đạt được mục tiêu này. Nhưng trước hết, chúng ta cần phải thảo luận thêm về các chi tiết kỹ thuật và đảm bảo rằng tất cả mọi người đều hiểu rõ về kế hoạch của chúng ta. Tôi nghĩ rằng chúng ta nên tổ chức một cuộc họp để thảo luận về vấn đề này. Tôi sẽ gửi email cho mọi người vào sáng mai để thông báo về cuộc họp. Hãy chuẩn bị kỹ lưỡng và sẵn sàng để thảo luận về các vấn đề quan trọng này. Tôi tin rằng chúng ta sẽ đạt được thành công với sự hợp tác của nhau.

es_first_half: Estaba muy pálido, y sus ojos parecían salirse de sus órbitas, mientras, con una mezcla de terror y asombro, miraba fijamente a un hombre alto y delgado, de nariz aguileña, bigote negro y barba en punta, que también estaba observando a la muchacha bonita. La estaba mirando tan embebido que no se percató de nuestra presencia, y por ello pude echarle un buen vistazo. Su cara no era una buena cara; era dura y cruel, y sensual,
es_second_half: y sus grandes dientes blancos, que se miraban más blancos por el encendido rojo de sus labios, estaban afilados como los de un animal. Jonathan estuvo mirándolo tan fijamente que yo tuve hasta miedo de que el individuo lo notara. Y temí que lo tomara a mal, ya que se veía tan fiero y detestable. Le pregunté a Jonathan por qué estaba perturbado, y él me respondió, pensando evidentemente que yo sabía tanto como él cuando lo hizo:
es_results_raw: que parecía haber sido moldeada por la vida en un lugar oscuro y frío, donde la bondad y la compasión no tenían cabida. Sus ojos, negros como la noche, brillaban con una intensidad que me heló la sangre, y su sonrisa, que se esbozaba en sus labios finos, era un rictus que me hizo estremecer. La muchacha, por su parte, parecía estar hipnotizada por la presencia de aquel hombre, y no se movía ni un milímetro, como si estuviera atrapada en una red de seda. Su rostro, pálido y delicado, estaba bañado en una luz que parecía provenir de la propia oscuridad, y sus ojos, grandes y negros, brillaban con una intensidad que me hizo preguntarme si estaba viendo a una criatura de otro mundo. El hombre, por su parte, seguía mirando a la muchacha con una intensidad que parecía ser capaz de atravesar el alma, y su presencia parecía llenar el aire con un peso que me hizo sentir como si estuviera siendo aplastado por una montaña. La tensión en el aire era palpable, y pude sentir que cualquier movimiento en falso podría desencadenar una explosión de violencia y pasión. La muchacha, sin embargo, parecía estar completamente tranquila, como si estuviera esperando a que algo sucediera, y su presencia parecía ser la única que mantenía el equilibrio en aquella atmósfera cargada de electricidad. El hombre, por su parte, seguía mirando a la muchacha con una intensidad que parecía ser capaz de atravesar el alma, y su presencia parecía estar creando un vacío en el aire que me hizo sentir como si estuviera siendo arrastrado hacia un abismo sin fondo. La tensión en el aire seguía aumentando, y pude sentir que cualquier momento podría ser el momento en el que todo estallara en una explosión de violencia y pasión. La muchacha, sin embargo, seguía siendo la única que parecía estar tranquila, como si estuviera esperando a que algo sucediera, y su presencia parecía ser la única que mantenía el equilibrio en aquella atmósfera cargada de electricidad.

Adam genç kıza öyle dikkatle bakıyordu ki ikimizi de görmedi, böylece, onu iyice inceledim. Yüzü iyi bir yüz değildi; sert, acımasız ve tenseldi ve dudakları

Adamın eli, elini genç kızın omzuna koymuş gibi duruyordu ve ben de bu adamın elinin genç kızın omzuna değdiğini hissediyordum. Bu adamın yüz ifadesi, genç kızın yüz ifadesinden daha da sert ve acımasız görünüyordu. Genç kızın gözleri, adamın yüzüne bakmaktan kaçıyordu ve ben de bu adamın yüzüne bakmaktan kaçınmak istiyordum. Adamın burnu, bir kedinin burnu gibi sivriydi ve ben de bu adamın burnunun sivri olduğunu hissediyordum. Adamın bıyıkları, bir köpeğin bıyıkları gibi kalın ve siyahydı ve ben de bu adamın bıyıklarının kalın ve siyah olduğunu hissediyordum. Adamın sakalları, bir köpeğin sakalları gibi sivriydi ve ben de bu adamın sakallarının sivri olduğunu hissediyordum. Bu adamın yüzü, bir köpeğin yüzü gibiydi ve ben de bu adamın yüzünün bir köpeğin yüzü gibi olduğunu hissediyordum. Genç kızın, bu adamın yüzüne bakmasını istemeyen bir ifadeyle bakıyordu ve ben de bu adamın yüzüne bakmasını istemeyen bir ifadeyle bakıyordum. Bu adamın yüzü, bir köpeğin yüzü gibiydi ve ben de bu adamın yüzünün bir köpeğin yüzü gibi olduğunu hissediyordum.

en_first_half: 23 September.—Jonathan is better after a bad night. I am so glad that he has plenty of work to do, for that keeps his mind off the terrible things; and oh, I am rejoiced that he is not now weighed down with the responsibility of his new position. I knew he would be true to himself, and now how proud I am
en_second_half: to see my Jonathan rising to the height of his advancement and keeping pace in all ways with the duties that come upon him. He will be away all day till late, for he said he could not lunch at home. My household work is done, so I shall take his foreign journal, and lock myself up in my room and read it....

Me había estado preguntando si sabía algo sobre un nuevo restaurante que acaba de abrir en el centro de la ciudad, y si había oído hablar de su chef, que según dicen es un verdadero genio en la cocina. Pero, como siempre, me disculpé por mi error y le dije que no sabía nada al respecto, lo que me pareció una respuesta bastante razonable, pero que en realidad me sentí un poco avergonzado por mi falta de conocimiento sobre el tema. Me preguntó si quería acompañarlo a probar el restaurante, pero le dije que no, que no estaba en condiciones de comer nada, y que además no quería molestarle con mi presencia. Me dijo que no era necesario, que podía ir solo, pero que si cambiaba de opinión, sabía que estaba en su casa. Me dije a mí mismo que no iba a ir, pero al mismo tiempo, no podía evitar sentir un poco de curiosidad por saber qué era lo que había detrás de ese restaurante y de su chef, y si realmente era tan bueno como decían. Así que, después de un rato pensando, decidí que sí iba a ir, no porque fuera un gran fanático de la comida, sino porque quería saber más sobre ese lugar y sobre la persona que lo había creado. Me puse en marcha hacia el restaurante, con la mente llena de preguntas y con la esperanza de encontrar algo interesante.

Những người gặp gỡ bà đều cảm thấy được ấm áp, được an ủi, được khích lệ bởi tình yêu và sự yêu thương của bà. Họ cảm thấy được gần gũi với Chúa hơn, cảm thấy được hướng dẫn bởi ánh sáng của Ngài. Y aunque ella sea una mujer, su esencia es universal, su mensaje es para todos, sin distinción de edad, raza o condición social. en_first_half: “You are clever man, friend John; you reason well, and your wit is bold; but you are too prejudiced. You do not let your eyes see nor your ears hear, and that which is outside your daily life is not of account to you. Do you not think that there are things which you cannot understand, and yet which are; that some people see things that others cannot? But there are things old and new which must not be contemplate by men’s eyes, because they know—or think they know—some things which other men have
en_second_half: told them. Ah, it is the fault of our science that it wants to explain all; and if it explain not, then it says there is nothing to explain. But yet we see around us every day the growth of new beliefs, which think themselves new; and which are yet but the old, which pretend to be young—like the fine ladies at the opera. I suppose now you do not believe in corporeal transference. No? Nor in materialisation. No? Nor in astral bodies. No? Nor in the reading of thought. No? Nor in hypnotism——”
vi_first_half: — Anh thông minh lắm, John ạ. Anh có lý lẽ thật đúng đắn và cũng rất thật thà, nhưng anh đã không tránh được các định kiến chủ quan. Anh không chịu để mắt, để tai đến sự việc, và rõ ràng điều đó đã không trở thành một phần cuộc sống hàng ngày của anh, vì thế nên anh chẳng bao giờ nắm chắc được một điều gì cả. Chẳng lẽ anh không nghĩ trên đời này lại có những điều mặc dù anh không hiểu, nhưng vẫn tồn tại hay sao? Và rồi một số người trong chúng ta có thể thấy được những điều mà người khác không thể thấy nữa! Nhưng công bằng mà nói, trên đời này vẫn còn khối chuyện mà con người ta không thể hiểu nổi bởi vì họ biết hoặc là suy ngẫm, hoặc là nhận biết - những chuyện đó khác với những gì người ta đã dạy cho họ. Thế đấy!
vi_second_half: Đó chính là khiếm khuyết của khoa học: khoa học lúc nào cũng muốn giải thích tất cả, và khi không giải thích nổi, nó sẽ đưa ra một tuyên bố là chẳng có gì phải giải thích cả. Tuy nhiên, chúng ta có thể thấy ngày nào cũng có các học thuyết mới, hay nói đúng hơn là các học thuyết tự xưng là mới ra đời ở đâu đó, thực ra chúng chỉ là những lý thuyết cũ mèm nhưng lại được biện bạch sao cho thật mới mẻ, kiểu như những người đẹp mà ta vẫn thấy trong các nhà hát kịch ấy. Nào, bây giờ tôi xin được hỏi tiếp nhé, anh có tin ở sự biến hóa của các cơ thể không? Anh sẽ trả lời là không chứ? Anh cũng không tin ở thuyết vật chất hóa? Cũng là không? Thế còn các vật chiếu mệnh? Có hay không? Và thuyết đọc được ý nghĩ? Lại không?
vi_results_raw: Nhưng điều đó không có nghĩa là chúng ta không thể cố gắng tìm hiểu, cố gắng nhìn nhận mọi thứ một cách khách quan hơn. Chúng ta có thể học hỏi từ những người xung quanh, từ những trải nghiệm của mình, và từ những điều mà chúng ta đã học được. Và đôi khi, điều đó có thể giúp chúng ta nhìn nhận mọi thứ một cách khác, giúp chúng ta thấy được những điều mà trước đây chúng ta không thể thấy được. Nhưng điều quan trọng là phải biết khi nào nên tin vào những gì mình biết, và khi nào nên mở lòng để đón nhận những điều mới mẻ. Bởi vì, như người ta đã nói, "trong sự không biết, có thể là một phần của sự hiểu biết". Và đôi khi, điều đó có thể giúp chúng ta tránh được những định kiến chủ quan, và nhìn nhận mọi thứ một cách khách quan hơn. Nhưng điều đó không có nghĩa là chúng ta không thể có những ý kiến riêng, mà chỉ cần biết khi nào nên chia sẻ chúng, và khi nào nên giữ im lặng. en_second_half: dangerous; and if the child were to remain out another night, it would probably be fatal. But in any case I suppose you will not let it away for some days?”
en_results_raw: unusual and may be a sign of something more sinister at play. The child's imagination is a powerful tool, but it can also be a window into the darker corners of the human psyche. I have seen it before, the way the mind can create its own monsters, its own terrors. And I fear that this child may be more susceptible than most. The parents must be vigilant, for the sake of the child's own safety, and for the sake of the world around them. We cannot afford to have the shadows within the child's mind spreading their dark influence, not now, not ever. The world is already a fragile place, and we must do everything in our power to keep it from unraveling further. I will, of course, be keeping a close eye on the child myself, and I will do everything in my power to help it overcome these... these... I do not know what to call them, these dark visitations. But I fear that it will not be easy, and that the road ahead will be long and difficult. The child's parents must be prepared for the worst, and for the possibility that their child may never be the same again. The darkness that has taken hold of it may be too strong, too deep-seated, and it may never be fully exorcised. But we must try, we must try to save the child, to save it from the clutches of the darkness that threatens to consume it. We owe it to the child, to its parents, and to ourselves to do everything in our power to help it overcome this... this... this curse, this affliction, this... this darkness that has taken hold of it.

Por lo tanto, es crucial que sus padres estén al tanto de cualquier cambio en su comportamiento y que tomen medidas para protegerlo de cualquier influencia maligna que pueda surgir. Debe ser capaz de distinguir entre lo que es real y lo que es imaginario, y no permitir que la fantasía se convierta en una realidad que pueda dañarle o a los demás. Con la vigilancia y la guía adecuadas, es posible que el niño pueda disfrutar de estas historias sin correr riesgos innecesarios.

en_first_half: I cannot sleep, so I make this entry. But I must try to get a few hours’ sleep, as
en_second_half: Van Helsing is to call for me at noon. He insists that I shall go with him on another expedition.
en_results_raw: tomorrow I have a crucial meeting with my team to discuss the project's progress, and I still need to finalize the presentation. The hotel room is quiet, but the sound of the air conditioner is a constant hum in the background, making it difficult for me to relax. I've tried reading a book, but my mind keeps wandering back to the project's challenges. I've been working on this project for months, and it's been a rollercoaster of emotions - from excitement and optimism to frustration and self-doubt. I've made some great connections with my team members, but we still have a lot of work to do before the deadline. I'm not sure if we'll be able to meet our goals, but I'm determined to give it my all and make it happen. I just wish I could get a few hours of uninterrupted sleep to clear my head and come back to this with a fresh perspective. Maybe I'll try to meditate or listen to some calming music to help me unwind. I'll try to get at least a few hours of sleep, and then I'll be ready to tackle the challenges ahead.
